name: df-vol
body: |- wceq(cvol, cres(covol, cab(s0, wral(s1, cima(ccnv(covol), cr), wceq(cfv(covol, cv(s1)), co(cfv(covol, cin(cv(s1), cv(s0))), caddc, cfv(covol, cdif(cv(s1), cv(s0)))))))))
comment: Define the Lebesgue measure, which is just the outer measure with a peculiar domain of definition. The property of being Lebesgue-measurable can be expressed as ` A e. dom vol ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 17-Mar-2014.)
